honeywell.connection

Class Connection_Bluetooth

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • honeywell.connection.ConnectionBase
        • honeywell.connection.Connection_Bluetooth
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Connection_Bluetooth
extends ConnectionBase
    This is the class for Android Bluetooth type connections. It extends Oneil's ConnectionBase class, and accesses the android.bluetooth package.

      • createClient

        public static Connection_Bluetooth createClient(java.lang.String targetDevice)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Create a bluetooth client connection. This function is used to create a connection to a bluetooth printer/server.
        Parameters:
        targetDevice - Bluetooth address of target device.
        Returns:
        Connection object that can be used to talk to the device.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Error caused by invalid Bluetooth address or bluetooth is disable/not supported

      • createClient

        public static Connection_Bluetooth createClient(java.lang.String targetDevice,
                                                boolean isAsync)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Create a bluetooth client connection. This function is used to create a connection to a bluetooth printer/server.
        Parameters:
        targetDevice - Bluetooth address of target device.
        isAsync - Will this Connection run asynchronously (multi-threaded)
        Returns:
        Connection object that can be used to talk to the device.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Error caused by invalid Bluetooth address or bluetooth is disable/not supported

      • createServer

        public static Connection_Bluetooth createServer(int port)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Create a bluetooth server connection. This function is used to create a connection which will listen for incoming bluetooth clients.
        Parameters:
        port - Port number to connect on.
        Returns:
        Connection object that can be used to talk to the device.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Error caused by invalid Bluetooth address or bluetooth is disable/not supported
